resources.string: Dial100 App requires access to your location to function properly.\nPlease enable location services to continue using the application.

Dial 100 App for Safety Assistance helps you in emergency by alerting the police. It alerts Police by sending emergency message along with your location. Your location data will be periodically updated so that Police can use this data to respond. \n\nTo use Dial 100 App during an emergency, press the SOS button switch to turn green for activating emergency. A one time registration sharing your contacts and your other emergency contact will be required for enabling and coordinating Police Service.

Dial 100 App for Safety assistance is intended to help users send quick notice of their approximate location to Police and also notify other mobile phone Numbers of an emergency contact that you choose in advance. It is made available only for your convenience and is not intended as, nor should it be treated as, a substitute for emergency calls to the Police authorities.

The accuracy of the location information and timely delivery of Safety assistance data may be affected by your surroundings and the condition of your devices and the device of your emergency contact.

Unless otherwise expressly stated or legally required, we disclaim any warranty that the Safety assistance function will work accurately continuously or without any error.

In order for Safety assistance to function as intended, it is necessary to have the function, once deployed by you, automatically turn on GPS or Network Provider Location functions of your device.

You acknowledge and agree to such automatic enabling of your GPS or use of Network Provider Location functions, without further notice to you or consent by you.
